titlestmt.titleproper: Hallie Flanagan papers from the Federal Theater Project

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:17:51 -0400.

did.unittitle: Hallie Flanagan papers from the Federal Theater Project

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, administrative records, personal files, articles, scripts, playbills, clippings, other printed material, and photographs.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels N/NDA 1-N/NDA 17 available for use at Archives of American Art, Washington, D.C. office; at the Franklin D. Roosevelt Library, Hyde Park, N.Y.; and at the New York Public Library, New York, N.Y.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in New York Public Library, Performing Arts Research Center, Theater Collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished material: Authorization to publish, quote or reproduce requires written permission from New York Public Library Theatre Collection. Contact Reference Services for more information.

userestrict.head: Terms of Use
userestrict.p: The Archives of American Art makes its archival collections available for non-commercial, educational and personal use unless restricted by copyright and/or donor restrictions, including but not limited to access and publication restrictions. AAA makes no representations concerning such rights and restrictions and it is the user's responsibility to determine whether rights or restrictions exist and to obtain any necessary permission to access, use, reproduce and publish the collections. Please refer to the Smithsonian's Terms of Use for additional information.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: National Director of the Federal Theater Project. FTP was established in 1935 as part of the Works Progress Administration Federal Project No. 1. It was abolished in 1939 when funding was cut in the Reorganization Act of 1939.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Flanagan's papers were filmed by AAA during a project called "New Deal and the Arts" which AAA directed from 1963-1966.
